meanings.definition: To make promises or claims that exceed what can realistically be delivered.
meanings.sent1: She kept overpromising about finishing her homework early.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overpromise when it comes to completing tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The magician was overpromising that he could make an elephant disappear with a snap of his fingers.
meanings.sent4: The salesman was overpromising the benefits of the product to make a quick sale.
meanings.sent5: The coach was overpromising victory to his team, setting them up for disappointment.

meanings.definition: The act of making excessive or unrealistic promises.
meanings.sent1: Her constant overpromising led to a lack of trust from her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The company's downfall was due to the CEO's overpromising in the annual report.
meanings.sent3: The overpromising in his speech made the audience chuckle at the absurdity of his claims.
meanings.sent4: The politician's overpromising during the campaign left voters feeling deceived.
meanings.sent5: The student's overpromising of perfect grades was shattered when the exam results came out.
